alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 7:52AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including eastern Santa Barbara county and western Ventura county. * WHEN...Until 930 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. Hourly rainfall rates between 0.25 and 0.50 continue to be observed. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Ventura, Santa Barbara, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Montecito, Moorpark, Santa Paula and Carpinteria. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
